privacy.title: Privacy Policy â€“ Ferrio App
privacy.s1p1: The data controller is Andrzej Chmiel, publisher of the Ferrio mobile app.
privacy.s1p2: Contact: via the in-app report form.
privacy.s2p1: Ferrio processes only the user's email address when logging in via Google.
privacy.s2p2: The email address is used solely to:
privacy.s2i1: link reports (bug reports or holiday suggestions) to the user's account,
privacy.s2i2: block an account in case of abuse (e.g., spam).
privacy.s2p3: When using anonymous login, no personal data is collected.
privacy.s3p1: Data is processed using Firebase (Google LLC).
privacy.s3p2: User identifiers are additionally stored on the administrator's server (OVH, EU) to associate reports with accounts.
privacy.s4p1: Users can submit bug reports or suggest new holidays.
privacy.s4p2: Report contents may include personal information entered voluntarily by the user. Such data is not required or used for any other purpose.
privacy.s5p2: The legal basis is the legitimate interest of the controller under Article 6(1)(f) of the GDPR.
privacy.s6p1: No data is shared with third parties except for Firebase, which acts as a data processor under Google's terms.
privacy.s7p1: Data is stored as long as the user keeps using the app.
privacy.s7p2: Anonymous accounts can be deleted by clearing app data.
privacy.s7p3: Google accounts can be disconnected in Google settings.
privacy.s8i2: request deletion, correction, or restriction of processing,
privacy.s8i4: file a complaint with a supervisory authority.
privacy.s9p1: All data is protected in accordance with current Firebase security standards.
privacy.s10p1: The privacy policy may be updated. The current version will always be available in the app and on ferrio.app.
